\maketitle


\begin{abstract}

The relaxation of the collective quadrupole motion in the 
initial 
stage of a central heavy ion collision at beam energies 
$E_{lab}=5\div20$ AMeV is studied within a microscopic kinetic
transport model.
The damping rate is shown to be a non-monotonic function of $E_{lab}$ 
for
a given pair of colliding nuclei. This fact is 
interpreted as a 
manifestation of the zero-to-first sound transition in a 
finite nuclear 
system.

\end{abstract}  


\vspace{0.5cm}


\section{ Introduction }

motions of 
heated nuclear systems is a challenging problem for the 
nuclear transport
theory. Following the analogy with other Fermi liquids,
like the liquid $^3$He
